page.title: 09CHANGES IN WOTTON
page.content: 100 YEARS AGO WOTTON WAS INHABITED BY COUNTRY PEOPLE AND ANIMALS. HORSES, CARTS AND CARRIAGES WERE IMPORTANT FEATURES, WATER WAS PUMPED FROM WELLS AND MOST INHABITANTS WERE BORN, MARRIED AND DIED IN WOTTON. 10 CHILDREN TO A FAMILY WAS NORMAL. POACHING WAS PROBABLY THE MOST COMMON CRIME BEFORE 1914. ON GOOD FRIDAY AFTERNOON IT WAS THE CUSTOM TO WALK TO NIBLEY KNOLL. THIS AND OTHER CUSTOMS SUCH AS MAYPOLE DANCING, MAY WALKING AND TRADITIONAL CHILDRENS' GAMES DIED WHEN THE MOTOR CAR BECAME POPULAR. THE FIRST COUNCIL HOUSES WERE BUILT AFTER WORLD WAR 1 IN LISLE PLACE. GRADUALLY FIELDS AND ANIMALS RECEDED. YOUNG WOTTONIANS BEGAN LEAVING HOME TO WORK IN THE TOWNS AND PEOPLE FROM THE TOWNS WERE MOVING OUT TO LIVE IN THE COUNTRY. BY THE END OF THE 1930s OLD WOTTON WAS LOST FOR EVER.
